title: [K-12] Collaborative Science Inquiry Environment Design Using Mobile Technology: Enhancing Variable Control and Evidence-Based Analysis

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of secondary science curriculum content (experimental design, observation methods, variable differentiation) and basic instructional design principles, along with foundational knowledge of the scientific inquiry process (observation → hypothesis → experiment → conclusion)
context.additional_context: Collaborative learning environment in constrained smartphone-based settings, emphasizing the scientific inquiry process (observation→hypothesis→experiment→conclusion). Focuses on variable control, measurement accuracy, and evidence-based conclusions.

learning_goals: Design three or more individualized scientific inquiry scenarios using mobile technology (including hypothesis formulation, control of independent/dependent variables, and quantitative data measurement/analysis).

Plan collaborative learning activities for scientific analysis (data comparison, graph interpretation) and evidence-based discussions (experimental result verification, conclusion drawing) using collaborative learning tools.
Exchange feedback with peer teachers (regarding experimental design validity and scientific rigor of result interpretation) using smartphone-based project evaluation tools.

resources: AR app for science education (e.g., Lab4Physics)
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
